result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas W. Schulke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park
Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park

supervisions.notes: Defendant eligible for early discharge after 3 years upon Agent's application.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or education or any combination thereof.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 72 hours of any new or changing prescriptions.
Defendant shall notify Agent within 72 hours of any doctor appointments.
Credit for 39 days, if probation is revoked.

timeConds.notes:
3 months stayed.  To be used at Agents discretion.
Jail time to be coordinated by Agent and jail.
Complete 1 hour CSW per week until obtained employment/education (full time) and provide verified documentation to Agent.
